column2: The population of [Root.GetName] consists mainly of non-human scum. As a human I can't bear to see those creatures taking land and jobs from honest hard working fellow humans. A little housecleaning is in order.
The population of [Root.GetName] consists mainly of non-human scum. Although they are somewhat protected by laws, making me unable to kill them outright, I can still make them miserable.
Lets see how long they will last.
Seems like my non-human policies have worked very well, humans now make the most of peasantry while those scums died from starvation, diseases and best part was that they suffered.
The population of [Root.GetName] consisted mainly of non-human scum. Or at least it did, after Pogrom the population is now mostly human, at least the one that survived it.
The population of [Root.GetName] consists mainly of non-human scum. As a devote follower of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] I can't bear to see those abominations plaguing this land any longer.

[Root.GetName] have been under ruled of elves for a while . Humans have been leaving the province fearing retribution for the long years of oppression and with an recent influx of elven settlers the population is mainly elven now.
Under your rule the dwarves of [Root.GetName] have slowly but steadily taken over [Root.GetName]
column3: s economy filling all the influential positions. This situation have attracted even more dwarves from less fortunate lands and the population is mainly dwarven now.

column2: The Halflings of [Root.GetName] have slowly but steadily migrated to [Root.GetName] in small numbers. Planting gardens and tilling fields. Halflings from throughout The Continent moved in to grab their piece of land the population is mainly halfling now.
The [Root.Culture.GetName] populace in [Root.GetName] have embraced [Root.Holder.Culture.GetName] culture.
My roots may be [Root.Culture.GetName], but I identify more with the [Root.Capital.Culture.GetName] people I rule.
[From.GetTitledName] has adopted the foreign ways of [From.Capital.GetName], behaving more like a petty [From.Capital.Culture.GetName] burgher than a proper [Root.Culture.GetName] lord.
The people of [Root.GetName] have embraced the faith of [Root.Holder.Religion.GetName].
I may be a follower of [Root.Religion.GetName], but I find the faith of the people I rule - the faith of [Root.Capital.Religion.GetName] more veracious.
Never, I am still a follower of [Root.Religion.GetName]!

[From.GetTitledName] has been influenced by [From.Capital.GetName] and have started to follow the foreign beliefs of [From.Capital.Religion.GetName], forgetting the true faith of [Root.Religion.GetName].
[Root.GetName] have long last embraced the official religion of glorious Nilfgaard Empire. The people have finally come to their minds and joined the fold of the true faith.
The presence and deeds of Order of the Flaming Rose in [Root.GetName] have moved the people and encouraged them to become followers of Eternal Fire.
The presence of faith of Eternal Fire have been growing lately in [Root.GetName]. By now more than half of population of have become followers and the number is increasing by day.
A druid have been appeared in [Root.GetName]. His passionate speeches and diligence have moved the hearts of locals most of whom have embraced his teachings.
Followers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] have a strong presence in [Root.GetName], but after taking strict measures the cult have been wiped out or gone in hiding at least.

Your twisted personality have made your fellow men avoid you and now you feel that even [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] have left you. The only religion that could accept you as you are is faith of Coram Agh Tera.
I will not become a crazy cultist.
There have been rumors that [From.GetTitledName] has embraced the heretical ways of Coram Agh Tera, becoming a bloodthirsty cultist and abandoning the true faith of [Root.Culture.GetName].
